definition: to open/to start/to initiate/to enlighten or awaken/to state/to inform
Qi son of Yu the Great 禹[Yu3], reported founder of the Xia Dynasty 夏朝[Xia4 Chao2] (c. 2070-c. 1600 BC)

sentences.english: I think it means re-booting your brain.
sentences.chinese: 我认为创新意味着重启你的大脑。

sentences.english: However, messages will survive application restarts and network failures.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在应用程序重启和网络故障时消息可以保留。

sentences.english: Rest assured: You can do it with the confidence that no machine will be rebooted. Go ahead, do it
sentences.chinese: 放心吧，在进行此操作时，机器不会重启。

sentences.english: But that may complicate TARP's objective of jumpstarting lending.
sentences.chinese: 但这可能会让TARP重启贷款的目标更加复杂化。

sentences.english: To restart, please clearly state “Restart” and speak your passcode.
sentences.chinese: 需重启，请清楚的陈述“重启”并说出你的密码。

sentences.english: To restart, please clearly state “Restart” and speak your passcode.
sentences.chinese: 需重启，请清楚的陈述“重启”并说出你的密码。

sentences.english: Therefore it can be said that all parties have made their contributions to the re-opening of the six party talks.
sentences.chinese: 可以说，各方都为重启六方会谈做出了自已的贡献。

sentences.english: Has the Chinese side met with them? What kind of expectation does China have for the resumption of the Six-Party Talks?
sentences.chinese: 中方是否会见了双方代表，对重启六方会谈有何期待？

sentences.english: Use the following tools to help diagnose the problem after first re-booting the servers in the cluster.
sentences.chinese: 先将集群内服务器重启，再使用下列工具诊断问题。

sentences.english: When the failed server restarts, processing will resume on that server.
sentences.chinese: 在故障服务器重启之后，处理会得到恢复。

sentences.english: What is China's stance on the resumption of the Six-Party Talks?
sentences.chinese: 中方对重启六方会谈持何立场？

sentences.english: As a result, the United States re-opened diplomatic ties with Libya.
sentences.chinese: 因此，美国重启与利比亚的外交关系。

sentences.english: He said the premier, Wen Jiabao, would push for denuclearisation and a return to the six-party talks.
sentences.chinese: 他说，总理温家宝将推动无核化进程和重启六方会谈。

sentences.english: It seems difficult to re-open negotiations now, but I don't exclude anything.
sentences.chinese: 但看上去重启谈判很困难，但是我不排除任何可能。

sentences.english: The chief purser is currently resetting the system so the PTV should restart soon.
sentences.chinese: 主任乘务长正在重启系统，您的个人电视马上就恢复。

sentences.english: Reboot the zone to effect the resources allocated for a particular zone.
sentences.chinese: 重启专区，使为特定专区分配的资源生效。

definition: to withdraw/to abort/to quit/to log out (computing)
to start (a machine)/(fig.) to set in motion/to launch (an operation)/to activate (a plan)
to cease/to suspend/to break off/to stop/to discontinue
plan/project/program/to plan/to map out/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]
